Component: Layout

Media Queries

When possible, we should aim to follow "Mobile first design" approach, i.e., desiging for smaller screens first, then tweak design / features / content for larger screens.

Below you'll see 2 sets of variables: Legacy and Next-gen. Currently tesla.com is based in the Legacy media queries and will likely remain so for the foreseeable future. We use the following media queries to create the key breakpoints in our grid system.

Available Media Queries

We have several media query variables that were developed a long time back and are starting to ... show their age. These are still relevant, but allowing for more flexibility to developers means having a few additional media queries available.

Variable Name Value Sample Devices Type
Note: All of tesla.com is built on these so-called "legacy" media queries, and therefore has been the defacto standard when it comes to building pages using breakpoints.
$mobile-only 0-639px
  • HTC One, Galaxy S3/S4/S5 (639px)
  • iPhone 5/5S (568px)
  • iPhone 4 (480px)
Legacy
$small-desktop-only 640px-940px
  • Small screens only (640px - 960px)
Legacy
$small-desktop 640px+
  • Small devices (640px+)
Legacy
$large-desktop 960px+
  • Large desktop screens (960px+)
Legacy
$mobile-phone-only 0-736px
  • HTC One (639px)
  • Galaxy S3/S4/S5 (639px)
  • iPhone 5/5S (568px)
  • iPhone 4 (480px)
  • iPhone 6 (667px)
  • iPhone 6+ (736px)
New
$tablet-only 601-1280px
  • iPad (768px - 1024px)
  • Galaxy (800px - 1280px)
  • Nexus (601px - 906px)
  • Kindle (800px - 1280px)
New
$large-devices 1200px+
  • gigantic screens?
New

Form Footer

A common component in forms is the cancel, submit, notification area.

Minimum requirements

  • There will always be at least one button
  • There will always be a separator bar between the component and the form content

Optional items

  • A disclaimer/notification
  • Multiple buttons (but better if no more than 2 total).

Ordering on Mobile

When looking at a form on mobile, the source order doesn't necessarily match what it should be. Addressing this with flexbox ordering

  1. Disclaimer
  2. Buttons
    1. btn-primary
    2. btn-secondary
    3. btn-tertiary
    4. btn-transactional
    5. btn-outline
    6. btn-transparent

NOTE: If you ever get to the point where you have 6 buttons in this type of an element, there is definitely something wrong.

Nulla accumsan quam nec lectus tristique, non commodo arcu rutrum.

Cancel
▲ 
<div class="tsla-form_footer">
  <p class="tsla-form_footer-notify">Nulla accumsan quam nec lectus tristique, non commodo arcu rutrum.</p>
  <div class="btn-group">
    <a href="#" class="btn-secondary">Cancel</a>
    <input type="submit" class="btn-primary" value="Submit">
  </div>
</div>
